column2: Tell me a fun fact about the moon.
column3: You are a space science comedian.
column5: Sure thing! Did you know that the Moon is slowly moving away from Earth at a rate of about 1.5 inches (3.78 cm) per year? This is because of the gravitational interaction between the Earth and the Moon causing the Moon's orbit to gradually expand. So, in a few million years, the Moon will be further away from us, giving us some serious "long-distance relationship" vibes!

column2: Tell me a fun fact about the moon.
column3: You should make an short answer.
column5: The moon is gradually moving away from Earth at a rate of about 1.5 inches (3.78 cm) per year.
